festival.introText:
Join Revival as they throw back to the eras of Dance, Pop, Garage, Rave, DnB & everywhere in-between! 

 

Revival in the Park are back for what's sure to be another amazing event, and with their BIGGEST line-up to date, a new arena host and four awesome arenas, you would be mad to miss this!

  

EXPECT:

BRAND NEW STAGES 

STUNNING PRODUCTION & SFX 

FOODS OF THE WORLD VILLAGE 

COCKTAIL TOWN AND PROSECCO PARLOUR 

FAIRGROUND 

CHILL OUT AREAS 

NEW, SIDE OF STAGE VIP AREA 

+ MORE

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: Best outdoor event we went to this year!

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: Great event loved it but using tokens instead of card was a joke

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: Token system was ridiculous. So many tokens left over at the end of the event as it's difficult to anticipate how many to buy. And nothing cost just 5 or 10 so you are going to have tokens left over anyway. Some food seemed way too expensive - a wrap for 10?! And freshly baked pizza that was just a naan bread with tomato and cheese on top....

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: tents were a bit cold due to September and open doors. Good idea with the 2 for a cup which you then kept, never been anywhere before where there's been so little rubbish

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: DJ Vibes set in Slipmatt's Rave Cave with MC Charlie B....

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: really good atmosphere but poor toilet quality  an tokens for drinks seem like extra work, the bar ques were very slow

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: Great day and night. not to good selling drinks tokens in blocks of 10. you are almost guaranteed to leave with some in your pocket, resulting in more money for the organisers

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: The music was amazing. Security were friendly and helpful. Prices were fair. I was dubious about the token idea....but it's actually a great idea. Will definitely go again. The atmosphere was old skool and as always ravers are awesome folk. Thank you So much to ALL involved in making this a sanfrantastic end to a glorious festival season. xx

reviews.title: Review of Revival In The Park 2022
reviews.body: Good festival, drinks and food were a little over priced. Tokens were a bit of a pain rather than paying with cash or card. Vengaboys were the highlight of it all

faqs.question: When is Revival in the Park 2023?
faqs.answer: Revival in the Park takes place Friday 14th July - Saturday 15th July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to to Revival in the Park by car
faqs.answer:
If you’re looking to arrive by car, you will need to purchase a parking ticket from our ticket page.

If you’re camping, you will need to purchase a parking ticket for both days.

 

The car park situated within Mote Park’s main entrance is for park users only.

 

Please note, we strongly advise that you do not park in and around residential areas surrounding the park

and doing so will run the risk of you receiving a parking ticket.

faqs.question: Can you camp at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
You can! If you hold a weekend ticket and would like to enhance your festival experience – you can add a camping ticket to your order!

 

Please note camping tickets are required per person – not per tent!

 

If you would like to park your car over the weekend while camping – you will also need a camping parking ticket!

faqs.question: What is accessibility like at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: The event is fully wheelchair accessible.

faqs.question: How much is a ticket for Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Adult general admission tickets are from £49.50 + booking fee for a full weekend ticket or £24.50 + booking fee for a day ticket.

faqs.question: How to get to to Revival in the Park by train
faqs.answer:
Maidstone West Station – 1.3 miles from Mote Park 

 

Maidstone Barracks Station – 1.7 miles from Mote Park 

 

Maidstone East Station – 1.4 miles from Mote Park

faqs.question: Where is Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
Revival in the Park is located in MoteMote Park in Maidstone, Kent Park in Maidstone, Kent 

 

The main Revival in the Park entrance will be situated opposite Mote Park Café, with Mote Park’s main entrance off Mote Avenue being the best way to access the site.

faqs.question: What time does the campsite open at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
The campsite will open at 12:00 on Friday 14th July and closes for entry / re-entry at midnight.

The campsite then reopens at 08:00 and closes for entry/re-entry at midnight on

Saturday 15th July 2023. The campsite will then close at 15:00 on Sunday 16th July.

faqs.question: Will there be accessible toilets at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be numerous accessible toilets on site.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: How to get to to Revival in the Park by bus
faqs.answer: The Mall Bus Station is located approximately one mile from Mote Park.

faqs.question: What facilities are available when camping at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
Standard camping facilities include: 

  • Luxury Toilets
  • Campsite Bar
  • Token Booth
  • Showers
  • Campsite Food Vendor
  • Phone Charging Stations

faqs.question: Does Revival in the Park offer complimentary carers tickets?
faqs.answer: Yes, customers are required to purchase a ticket for themselves, and then send the order confirmation, as well as a photo of their DLA/PIP letter to customer@lucuslive.com, where they will then process the documents and email you a carer pass free of charge.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: No, re-entry to the arena site is not allowed.

faqs.question: What does a VIP ticket for Revival in the Park include?
faqs.answer:
A VIP ticket includes everything included in a standard ticket plus...

  • Fast track entry
  • An amazing viewing area of the main stage
  • Private bar
  • Luxury loos
  • Chill out area with seating

faqs.question: Can I bring a motorhome / camper van to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
Yes they welcome camper vans / motorhomes into Revival!

You will have the option to purchase your camper van tickets with an electricity supply or without.

 

IMPORTANT: camper vans cannot exceed 24 feet

 

Camper Van Ticket w/ Power: £90.00 + Booking Fee

Camper Van Ticket w/o Power: £50.00 + Booking Fee

 

Please note camper van tickets are per vehicle, not per person. Each camper will also require a weekend festival ticket to attend the show. Camper van users will have access to the same facilities as those within the standard campsite.

faqs.question: Will there be a disabled viewing area at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be a designated viewing platform for disabled guests.

faqs.question: Can I bring food & drink into Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: You are not permitted to bring any food or drinks onto the site, apart from one 500ml sealed bottle of water per person.

faqs.question: Is there a glamping option available at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can choose from either glamping or go all out with the luxury glamping option!

 

Enhance your camping experience & stay in one of the festival's brand-new Glamping tents!

Less stress! Choose from a 4m, 5m or 6m pre-pitched bell-tent and let them do the hard work for you!

With the optional extra of adding bedding, camping essentials & homely touches to your bell tent,

all you’ll need to bring is yourself!

 

Each glamping pod will have it’s own extension lead (for mobile phone charging only).

 

Glamping tickets also include free parking for the weekend.

 

Glampers will have access to the same facilities as those within the standard campsite.

 

STANDARD GLAMPING

Standard glamping bell-tents remove the stress of having to erect your tent upon arrival.

The spacious bell tents are pre-pitched for you prior to your arrival, so you can move your belongings in and start enjoying the campsite features and the event immediately!

 

Please note, standard glamping tickets do not allow access to the festival site, and each glamper must purchase a weekend ticket, together with their group glamping ticket.

 

INTRODUCTORY GLAMPING OFFER

To celebrate the introduction of glamping to the event, Revival is offering the following pricing to the first 10 standard glamping customers!

FOUR PEOPLE: Standard Glamping Ticket (4m): £200.00 + Booking Fee

FIVE PEOPLE: Standard Glamping Ticket (5m): £300.00 + Booking Fee

SIX PEOPLE: Standard Glamping Ticket (6m): £400.00 + Booking Fee

Standard Glamping also includes free weekend parking, saving you £24.00 per vehicle!

 

LUXURY GLAMPING

The luxury glamping bell-tents are the top-tier glamping option. Let Revival take the stress out of camping and sort everything for you. The spacious bell tents will not only be pre-pitched for you prior to your arrival, they will be fully furnished, so you can enjoy the campsite features and the event immediately!

 

Facilities will include:

  • Air bed for each person
  • Extension lead / mobile phone charging
  • Rug carpet
  • Mirror
  • Fizz on arrival
  • Bedding for each person
  • Camping chairs for each person
  • Towel
  • Light
  • Free parking

 

Please email customer@lucuslive.com to let them know which bed orientations you would prefer (single/doubles).

 

Please note luxury glamping tickets do not allow access to the festival site, and each glamper must purchase a weekend ticket, together with their group glamping ticket.

 

FOUR PEOPLE: Luxury Glamping Ticket (4m): £560.00 + Booking Fee

FIVE PEOPLE: Luxury Glamping Ticket (5m): £600.00 + Booking Fee

SIX PEOPLE: Luxury Glamping Ticket (6m): £640.00 + Booking Fee

faqs.question: Is there disabled parking at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Yes, purchase your parking ticket from our ticket page. Show your blue badge upon arrival to the car park and the marshals will direct you to the disabled parking bays.

faqs.question: Can I bring my pet to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: No, please leave your pets safely at home. Registered guide dogs only.

faqs.question: What is not allowed on the campsites at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
The following is prohibited in campsites at Revival:

  • Glass of any kind (this includes food / drink bottles & perfume etc)
  • Alcohol which exceeds the allowed PP amount
  • Aerosols over 250ml
  • Air horns / Megaphones
  • Animals (other than registered hearing / guide dogs)
  • Blow torches
  • Drones
  • Firewood
  • Fireworks
  • Illegal substances (drugs) and legal / herbal highs
  • Nitrous Oxide and any items associated with the taking of
  • Petrol burners

faqs.question: Can I bring a chair of a blanket to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: You’re welcome to bring your own seating (folding, camping chairs) and blankets to sit on, however please be aware that these cannot be placed directly in front of the stage because it creates a hazard. You must be behind the barriers, which will be clearly signposted.

faqs.question: Can I bring my BBQ / camping stove?
faqs.answer: This year disposable BBQ’s and camping stoves will be allowed into the camp site, should you wish to cook for yourselves rather than visit the campsite street food vendors. There will be ample fire extinguishers situated throughout the campsite for your safety.

faqs.question: Can I bring my perfume or cosmetics to Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Cosmetics are allowed to be brought into the event, however please note that all glass vessels will be confiscated and will not be returned. Please leave all glass cosmetics at home.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the food / alcohol I can bring with me?
faqs.answer:
Camping Ticket Holders can bring the following into the campsite area only.

No food or drink can be taken into the main arena from the campsite.

 

8x cans of beer / cider per person

 

OR

 

1x bottle of wine per person (for the whole weekend, not per day)

 

Food

Soft drinks

faqs.question: Can I pay via cash or card at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately not, you won’t be able to purchase any food or drink at the event without tokens. Please see our other FAQs for information on tokens.

faqs.question: Is there anything else I should know about camping at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
You can leave the campsite to go back to your car, or to visit the Sainsbury’s which is approx 10min walk away.

You will be searched by security on re-entry each time.

 

No food or drink from the campsite can be taken into the main arena.

 

There are no official pitch sizes, but we ask that campers are considerate to others when considering their tent sizes

 

There will be no power at your pitch, however there will be extension leads within the campsite where you can charge your mobile phone (this is left to charge at your own risk & Revival hold no responsibility for lost or stolen items whilst being charged).

faqs.question: Token information for Revival in the Park
faqs.answer:
HOW CAN I PURCHASE TOKENS?

You can purchase your tokens on the day with both cash and card at the on-site token booth.

 

WHY IS IT TOKENS ONLY?

Despite the possibility of having to queue at the token booth to purchase your tokens when you arrive on-site, once you have them you can be sure that the overall speed of service at both the bar and street food vendors is faster in comparison to accepting cash/card.

 

It can take 2-3 minutes per cash/card transaction when you take into account: card machine input, till input, card verification, which is also subject to atmospheric conditions (thr Wi-Fi is satellite based due to the event site location).

 

A token transaction takes a matter of seconds. This speeds up service at the bar and ensures you are never waiting long for your food and drink throughout the entirety of the event.

 

HOW MANY TOKENS SHOULD I BUY?

As you can purchase tokens in denominations of £5, and excess tokens are non-refundable, we would encourage you to only purchase what you need,  and return to the token booth later in the day should you need more tokens.

 

CAN I BUY TOKENS IN ADVANCE?

Unfortunately you can only buy tokens on site on the day of the event.

faqs.question: What drink prices can I expect at Revival in the Park?
faqs.answer:
• Beer / Cider (Pint) - 6/7 Tokens
  • Spirit + Mixer (Single) - 6/7 Tokens
  • Spirit + Mixer (Double) - 10/11 Tokens
  • Wine / Prosecco - 8/9 Tokens
  • Soft Drinks - 3/4 Tokens

 

Please note, all food vendors are independent and therefore charge their own prices.
